race.description:
The ancestors of dragonborn hatched from the eggs of chromatic and metallic dragons.

Dragonborn Traits
Dragon Ancestry, Breath Weapon, Damage Resistance, Darkvision, Draconic Flight

definition.name: Ability Score Increases
definition.description: When determining your character’s ability scores, increase one score by 2 and a different one by 1, or increase three scores by 1. None of these increases can raise a score above 20.
definition.snippet: When determining your character’s ability scores, increase one score by 2 and a different one by 1, or increase three scores by 1.

definition.name: Creature Type
definition.description: You are a Humanoid.
definition.snippet: You are a Humanoid.

definition.name: Size
definition.description: Your size is Medium (about 5–7 feet tall).
definition.snippet: Your size is Medium.

definition.name: Speed
definition.description: Your speed is 30 ft.
definition.snippet: Your speed is 30 ft.

definition.name: Draconic Ancestry
definition.description:
Your lineage stems from a dragon progenitor. Choose the kind of dragon from the Draconic Ancestors table. Your choice affects your Breath Weapon and Damage Resistance traits as well as your appearance.

Draconic Ancestors
Dragon Damage Type
Black Acid
Blue Lightning
Brass Fire
Bronze Lightning
Copper Acid
Gold Fire
Green Poison
Red Fire
Silver Cold
White Cold
definition.snippet: You gain a breath weapon and damage resistance with your chosen dragon type.

definition.name: Breath Weapon
definition.description:
When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with an exhalation of magical energy in either a 15-foot Cone or a 30-foot Line that is 5 feet wide (choose the shape each time). Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC 8 plus your Constitution modifier and Proficiency Bonus). On a failed save, a creature takes 1d10 damage of the type determined by your Draconic Ancestry trait. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage. This damage increases by 1d10 when you reach character levels 5 (2d10), 11 (3d10), and 17 (4d10).

You can use this Breath Weapon a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.
definition.snippet: When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with an exhalation of magical energy. You can use your Breath Weapon {{proficiency#unsigned}} times per Long Rest.

definition.name: Damage Resistance
definition.description: You have Resistance to the damage type determined by your Draconic Ancestry trait.
definition.snippet: You have Resistance to the damage type determined by your Draconic Ancestry trait.

definition.name: Darkvision
definition.description: You have Darkvision with a range of 60 feet.
definition.snippet: You have Darkvision with a range of 60 ft.

definition.name: Draconic Flight
definition.description: When you reach character level 5, you can channel draconic magic to give yourself temporary flight. As a Bonus Action, you sprout spectral wings on your back that last for 10 minutes or until you retract the wings (no action required) or have the Incapacitated condition. During that time, you have a Fly Speed equal to your Speed. Your wings appear to be made of the same energy as your Breath Weapon. Once you use this trait, you can’t use it again until you finish a Long Rest.
definition.snippet: Once per Long Rest as a Bonus Action, you gain temporary flight for 10 minutes or until you retract the wings (no action required) or have the Incapacitated condition. During that time, you have a Fly Speed equal to your Speed.

definition.name: Languages
definition.description:
Your character knows at least three languages: Common plus two languages you roll or choose from the Standard Languages table. Knowledge of a language means your character can communicate in it, read it, and write it. Your class and other features might also give you languages.

The Standard Languages table lists languages that are widespread on D&D worlds. Every player character knows Common, which originated in the planar metropolis of Sigil, the hub of the multiverse. The other standard languages originated with the first members of the most prominent species in the worlds of D&D and have since spread widely.

Standard Languages
1d12 Language Origin
— Common Sigil
1 Common Sign Language Sigil
2 Draconic Dragons
3-4 Dwarvish Dwarves
5-6 Elvish Elves
7 Giant Giants
8 Gnomish Gnomish
9 Goblin Goblinoids
10-11 Halfling Halflings
12 Orc Orcs
definition.snippet: Your character knows at least three languages: Common plus two languages you roll or choose from the Standard Languages table. Knowledge of a language means your character can communicate in it, read it, and write it.

properties.name: Light
properties.description: When you take the [action]Attack[/action] action on your turn and attack with a Light weapon, you can make one extra attack as a Bonus Action later on the same turn. That extra attack must be made with a different Light weapon, and you don’t add your ability modifier to the extra attack’s damage unless that modifier is negative. For example, you can attack with a [items]Shortsword[/items] in one hand and a [items]Dagger[/items] in the other using the [action]Attack[/action] action and a Bonus Action, but you don’t add your Strength or Dexterity modifier to the damage roll of the Bonus Action unless that modifier is negative.

properties.name: Thrown
properties.description: If a weapon has the Thrown property, you can throw the weapon to make a ranged attack, and you can draw that weapon as part of the attack. If the weapon is a Melee weapon, use the same ability modifier for the attack and damage rolls that you use for a melee attack with that weapon.

properties.name: Vex
properties.description: If you hit a creature with this weapon and deal damage to the creature, you have Advantage on your next attack roll against that creature before the end of your next turn.

definition.name: Handaxe
definition.description:
Proficiency with a Handaxe allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it.

This weapon has the following mastery property. To use this property, you must have a feature that lets you use it.

Vex. If you hit a creature with this weapon and deal damage to the creature, you have Advantage on your next attack roll against that creature before the end of your next turn.

If the weapon is a Melee weapon, use the same ability modifier for the attack and damage rolls that you use for a melee attack with that weapon.

properties.name: Slow
properties.description: If you hit a creature with this weapon and deal damage to it, you can reduce its Speed by 10 feet until the start of your next turn. If the creature is hit more than once by weapons that have this property, the Speed reduction doesn't exceed 10 feet.

definition.name: Javelin
definition.description:
Proficiency with a Javelin allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it.

This weapon has the following mastery property. To use this property, you must have a feature that lets you use it.

Slow. If you hit a creature with this weapon and deal damage to it, you can reduce its Speed by 10 feet until the start of your next turn. If the creature is hit more than once by weapons that have this property, the Speed reduction doesn’t exceed 10 feet.

properties.name: Heavy
properties.description: You have [rules]Disadvantage[/rules] on attack rolls with a Heavy weapon if it’s a Melee weapon and your Strength score isn’t at least 13 or if it’s a Ranged weapon and your Dexterity score isn’t at least 13.

properties.name: Two-Handed
properties.description: A Two-Handed weapon requires two hands when you attack with it.

properties.name: Graze
properties.description: If your attack roll with this weapon misses a creature, you can deal damage to that creature equal to the ability modifier you used to make the attack roll. This damage is the same type dealt by the weapon, and the damage can be increased only by increasing the ability modifier.

definition.name: Greatsword
definition.description:
Proficiency with a Greatsword allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it.

This weapon has the following mastery property. To use this property, you must have a feature that lets you use it.

Graze. If your attack roll with this weapon misses a creature, you can deal damage to that creature equal to the ability modifier you used to make the attack roll. This damage is the same type dealt by the weapon, and the damage can be increased only by increasing the ability modifier.

definition.name: Backpack
definition.description:
A backpack is a leather pack carried on the back, typically with straps to secure it. A backpack can hold 1 cubic foot/ 30 pounds of gear.

You can also strap items, such as a bedroll or a coil of rope, to the outside of a backpack.

properties.name: Heavy
properties.description: You have [rules]Disadvantage[/rules] on attack rolls with a Heavy weapon if it’s a Melee weapon and your Strength score isn’t at least 13 or if it’s a Ranged weapon and your Dexterity score isn’t at least 13.

properties.description: A Two-Handed weapon requires two hands when you attack with it.

This damage is the same type dealt by the weapon, and the damage can be increased only by increasing the ability modifier.

definition.name: M'Jarek Quebrada
definition.description:
Em seu estado inerte, funciona como uma Shortword. Com uma Bonus Action, o usuário pode invocar o espírito da lâmina, materializando-a em uma montante espiritual invisível aos olhos comuns (o usuário consegue vê-la). Requer 16 de Força para manejo proficiente. É tão grande que em seu estado acordado possui a propriedade Reach. A espada pode desativar automaticamente caso M'Jarek considere seu alvo inocente.


Material: 1 Neterita (guarda), 1 Couro de Grifo (Empunhadura), 2 Pedra de Sangue (Lâmina rachada), 1 Ametista Amarela (Pomo);
Avaliação de Valor: 700gp, podendo alcançar 1500gp (avaliação DC 18) se para colecionadores.

 

Este cabo quebrado pertenceu ao herói Althaneriano Rakh’Amun Ki’Ori, (história DC 18) um defensor dos povos e protetor incansável dos caminhos entre as terras do império. Rakh’Amun era membro de uma ordem de aventureiros e heróis conhecidos por desafiar os perigos das terras selvagens e guiar os viajantes com segurança, (história DC 20) mas ele encontrou seu fim nas mãos dos exércitos de uma nobre família conhecida como os Criadores de Rios, cuja ganância e domínio sobre os caminhos fluviais os levou a temer a popularidade e a influência de Rakh’Amun entre o povo.

O espírito da lâmina, conhecido como M’Jarek (véu DC 16 ou história DC 24) – um guardião dos viajantes – foi vinculado à arma por juramento, leal a Rakh’Amun mesmo após a morte. Ao pronunciar o nome do espírito, M’Jarek manifesta-se em uma lâmina espiritual invisível olhos comuns não podem ver, mantendo a lealdade de proteger e jamais atacar inocentes. M’Jarek é sábio e honra o vínculo antigo que o liga ao espírito do herói.

Este cabo de espada não é meramente uma arma, mas um símbolo dos sacrifícios feitos por aqueles que desafiaram o poder e a corrupção, carregando consigo as lembranças e o juramento de um espírito que se recusa a descansar enquanto o nome do herói ecoa na história de Althaner.

definition.name: Água da Fonte Espiritual
definition.description:
Esta água tem propriedades mágicas. Com uma Bonus Action, beber ou dar de beber para uma criatura a 5 pés (1.5 metros) de você. A criatura que beber esta água cristalina e refrescante recupera 2d4 + 2 Hit Points.

 

A maioria das águas do outro lado do véu são nocivas para os mortais, mas com a ajuda de um espirito bondoso é possível purificar a água de forma que ela não apenas acabe com a sede mas que também alimente o espirito de quem a bebe.

properties.name: Ammunition
properties.description: You can use a weapon that has the Ammunition property to make a ranged attack only if you have ammunition to fire from it. The type of ammunition required is specified with the weapon’s range. Each attack expends one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition is part of the attack (you need a free hand to load a one-handed weapon). After a fight, you can spend 1 minute to recover half the ammunition (round down) you used in the fight; the rest is lost.

properties.name: Heavy
properties.description: You have [rules]Disadvantage[/rules] on attack rolls with a Heavy weapon if it’s a Melee weapon and your Strength score isn’t at least 13 or if it’s a Ranged weapon and your Dexterity score isn’t at least 13.

properties.name: Range
properties.description: A Range weapon has a range in parentheses after the [wprop]Ammunition[/wprop] or [wprop]Thrown[/wprop] property. The range lists two numbers. The first is the weapon’s normal range in feet, and the second is the weapon’s long range. When attacking a target beyond normal range, you have [rules]Disadvantage[/rules] on the attack roll. You can’t attack a target beyond the long range.

properties.name: Two-Handed
properties.description: A Two-Handed weapon requires two hands when you attack with it.

properties.name: Slow
properties.description: If you hit a creature with this weapon and deal damage to it, you can reduce its Speed by 10 feet until the start of your next turn. If the creature is hit more than once by weapons that have this property, the Speed reduction doesn't exceed 10 feet.

definition.name: Shael do Vento Silente
definition.description:
Apesar de ter sido produzido utilizando materiais relativamente simples, este arco longo foi produzido com maestria, adornado e imbuído usando materiais carregados de poder. Por fim, esta obra prima foi nomeada, ajudando a dar vida a sua própria essência (no entanto é notável a contradição causada pelo nome ter sido dado por outro que não o seu dono ou artesão).

Ao respirar fundo e se manter em silêncio enquanto se prepara o tiro, Shael oferece suporte ao portador, aumentando o alcance do tiro consideravelmente. O alcance passa a ser 225/900ft. 

A essência robusta da terra usada para imbuir o armamento aventua a confusão causada pelo nome, afinal este é um arco que está intrincicamente vinculado à terra. Enquanto vinculado ao portador, Shael compartilha seus sentidos com o mesmo, garantindo 100ft the tremorsense. 

Material: 2 Madeira Comum, 1 Couro Comum, 1 Ferro, 1 Inku da Terra Robusto;
Avaliação de Valor: 1680gp, no entanto as contradições impostas o tornam difícil de lidar, e alguns arqueiros podem não se sentir confortáveis quando o portam (Avaliação DC 12).
definition.attunementDescription: O portador precisa ficar em silêncio absoluto por 4 horas portando o arco.

properties.name: Versatile
properties.description: A Versatile weapon can be used with one or two hands. A damage value in parentheses appears with the property. The weapon deals that damage when used with two hands to make a melee attack.

properties.name: Topple
properties.description: If you hit a creature with this weapon, you can force the creature to make a Constitution saving throw (DC 8 plus the ability modifier used to make the attack roll and your Proficiency Bonus). On a failed save, the creature has the [condition]Prone[/condition] condition.

definition.name: Fúria em Brasa
definition.description:
Criada como um presente para o caçador de recompensas Big Bob, esta arma foi feita com uma liga especial que é capaz de cortar defesas mágicas de terceiro circulo, interagir com entidades etéreas e além disso incinerar seus oponentes. Sua aparência é deslumbrante, raízes investidas de Mitharil formam uma das lâminas, enquanto o ferro fantasma se entrelaça com elas formando a outra. Em seu centro, a essência ígnea enriquece as lâminas com labaredas de fogo. 

Apesar de sua essência frágil, o ímpeto do artesão está presente e vivo nesta arma. O som do fogo entoa um chamado estranho, quase inaudível, apenas para aqueles dispostos a ouvir. 

 

"Não é um lanca chamas mas também queima!" - Turquesa, sobre Fúria em Brasa

 

Material: 2 Mitharil, 2 Ferro Fantasma, Essência de Fogo Frágil, 1 Couro Comum.
Avaliação de Valor: 800gp, até 1200gp no norte (DC 18).

definition.name: Barbarian
definition.description:
A Fierce Warrior of Primal Rage

Barbarians are mighty warriors who are powered by primal forces of the multiverse that manifest as a Rage.

Primary Ability: Strength
Hit Point Die: D12
Saves: Strength & Constitution
definition.equipmentDescription:
Choose A or B:
(A) Greataxe, 4 Handaxes, Explorer’s Pack, and 15 GP; or
(B) 75 GP

classFeatures.name: Core Barbarian Traits
classFeatures.description:
As a Level 1 Character:

  • Gain all the traits in the Core Barbarian Traits table.
  • Gain the Barbarian’s level 1 features.
Core Barbarian Traits
Primary Ability Strength
Hit Point Die D12 per Barbarian level
Saving Throw Proficiencies Strength and Constitution
Skill Proficiencies Choose 2: Animal Handling, Athletics, Intimidation, Nature, Perception, or Survival
Weapon Proficiencies Simple and Martial weapons
Armor Training Light and Medium armor and Shields
Starting Equipment Choose A or B: (A) Greataxe, 4 Handaxes, Explorer’s Pack, and 15 GP; or (B) 75 GP

classFeatures.name: Rage
classFeatures.description:
You can imbue yourself with a primal power called Rage, a force that grants you extraordinary might and resilience. You can enter it as a Bonus Action if you aren’t wearing Heavy armor.

You can enter your Rage the number of times shown for your Barbarian level in the Rages column of the Barbarian Features table. You regain one expended use when you finish a Short Rest, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.

While active, your Rage follows the rules below.

Damage Resistance. You have Resistance to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage.

Rage Damage. When you make an attack using Strength—with either a weapon or an Unarmed Strike—and deal damage to the target, you gain a bonus to the damage that increases as you gain levels as a Barbarian, as shown in the Rage Damage column of the Barbarian Features table.

Strength Advantage. You have Advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws.

No Concentration or Spells. You can’t maintain Concentration, and you can’t cast spells.

Duration. The Rage lasts until the end of your next turn, and it ends early if you don Heavy armor or have the Incapacitated condition. If your Rage is still active on your next turn, you can extend the Rage for another round by doing one of the following:

  • Make an attack roll against an enemy.
  • Force an enemy to make a saving throw.
  • Take a Bonus Action to extend your Rage.

Each time the Rage is extended, it lasts until the end of your next turn. You can maintain a Rage for up to 10 minutes.

Select Activate Rage below to apply the effects from Rage. Deselect it to stop Raging.

classFeatures.description:

You can enter your Rage the number of times shown for your Barbarian level in the Rages column of the Barbarian Features table. You regain one expended use when you finish a Short Rest, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.

Rage Damage. When you make an attack using Strength—with either a weapon or an Unarmed Strike—and deal damage to the target, you gain a bonus to the damage that increases as you gain levels as a Barbarian, as shown in the Rage Damage column of the Barbarian Features table.

Strength Advantage. You have Advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws.

No Concentration or Spells. You can’t maintain Concentration, and you can’t cast spells.

Duration. The Rage lasts until the end of your next turn, and it ends early if you don Heavy armor or have the Incapacitated condition. If your Rage is still active on your next turn, you can extend the Rage for another round by doing one of the following:

  • Make an attack roll against an enemy.
  • Force an enemy to make a saving throw.
  • Take a Bonus Action to extend your Rage.

Each time the Rage is extended, it lasts until the end of your next turn. You can maintain a Rage for up to 10 minutes.

classFeatures.name: Unarmored Defense
classFeatures.description: While you aren’t wearing any armor, your base Armor Class equals 10 plus your Dexterity and Constitution modifiers. You can use a Shield and still gain this benefit.

classFeatures.name: Weapon Mastery
classFeatures.description:
Your training with weapons allows you to use the mastery properties of two kinds of Simple or Martial Melee weapons of your choice. Whenever you finish a Long Rest, you can practice weapon drills and change one of those weapon choices.

When you reach certain Barbarian levels, you gain the ability to use the mastery properties of more kinds of weapons, as shown in the Weapon Mastery column of the Barbarian Features table.

classFeatures.name: The Crooked Moon: Dark Bargain
classFeatures.description: At your GM's discretion, you can take a Dark Bargain.

classFeatures.name: Danger Sense
classFeatures.description: You gain an uncanny sense of when things aren’t as they should be, giving you an edge when you dodge perils. You have Advantage on Dexterity saving throws unless you have the Incapacitated condition.

classFeatures.name: Reckless Attack
classFeatures.description: You can throw aside all concern for defense to attack with increased ferocity. When you make your first attack roll on your turn, you can decide to attack recklessly. Doing so gives you Advantage on attack rolls using Strength until the start of your next turn, but attack rolls against you have Advantage during that time.

classFeatures.name: Barbarian Subclass
classFeatures.description: You gain a Barbarian subclass of your choice. A subclass is a specialization that grants you features at certain Barbarian levels. For the rest of your career, you gain each of your subclass’s features that are of your Barbarian level or lower.

classFeatures.name: Primal Knowledge
classFeatures.description:
You gain proficiency in another skill of your choice from the skill list available to Barbarians at level 1.

In addition, while your Rage is active, you can channel primal power when you attempt certain tasks; whenever you make an ability check using one of the following skills, you can make it as a Strength check even if it normally uses a different ability: Acrobatics, Intimidation, Perception, Stealth, or Survival. When you use this ability, your Strength represents primal power coursing through you, honing your agility, bearing, and senses.

classFeatures.name: Ability Score Improvement
classFeatures.description: You gain the Ability Score Improvement feat or another feat of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Barbarian levels 8, 12, and 16.

classFeatures.name: 4: Weapon Mastery
classFeatures.description:
Your training with weapons allows you to use the mastery properties of two kinds of Simple or Martial Melee weapons of your choice, such as Greataxes and Handaxes. Whenever you finish a Long Rest, you can practice weapon drills and change one of those weapon choices.

When you reach certain Barbarian levels, you gain the ability to use the mastery properties of more kinds of weapons, as shown in the Weapon Mastery column of the Barbarian Features table.

classFeatures.name: Extra Attack
classFeatures.description: You can attack twice instead of once whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

classFeatures.name: Fast Movement
classFeatures.description: Your speed increases by 10 feet while you aren’t wearing Heavy armor.

classFeatures.name: Feral Instinct
classFeatures.description: Your instincts are so honed that you have Advantage on Initiative rolls.

classFeatures.name: Instinctive Pounce
classFeatures.description: As part of the Bonus Action you take to enter your Rage, you can move up to half your Speed.

classFeatures.name: 8: Ability Score Improvement
classFeatures.description: You gain the Ability Score Improvement feat or another feat of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Barbarian levels 12 and 16.

classFeatures.name: Brutal Strike
classFeatures.description:
If you use Reckless Attack, you can forgo any Advantage on one Strength-based attack roll of your choice on your turn. The chosen attack roll mustn’t have Disadvantage. If the chosen attack roll hits, the target takes an extra 1d10 damage of the same type dealt by the weapon or Unarmed Strike, and you can cause one Brutal Strike effect of your choice. You have the following effect options.

Forceful Blow. The target is pushed 15 feet straight away from you. You can then move up to half your Speed straight toward the target without provoking Opportunity Attack;Opportunity Attacks.

Hamstring Blow. The target’s Speed is reduced by 15 feet until the start of your next turn. A target can be affected by only one Hamstring Blow at a time—the most recent one.

classFeatures.name: 10: Weapon Mastery
classFeatures.description: Your training with weapons allows you to use the mastery properties of another kind of Simple or Martial Melee weapons of your choice. Whenever you finish a Long Rest, you can practice weapon drills and change one of your chosen weapon choices.

classFeatures.name: Relentless Rage
classFeatures.description:
Your Rage can keep you fighting despite grievous wounds. If you drop to 0 Hit Points while your Rage is active and don’t die outright, you can make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw. If you succeed, your Hit Points instead change to a number equal to twice your Barbarian level.

Each time you use this feature after the first, the DC increases by 5. When you finish a Short or Long Rest, the DC resets to 10.

classFeatures.name: 12: Ability Score Improvement
classFeatures.description: You gain the Ability Score Improvement feat or another feat of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Barbarian level 16.

classFeatures.name: Improved Brutal Strike
classFeatures.description:
You have honed new ways to attack furiously. The following effects are now among your Brutal Strike options.

Staggering Blow. The target has Disadvantage on the next saving throw it makes, and it can’t make Opportunity Attack;Opportunity Attacks until the start of your next turn.

Sundering Blow. Before the start of your next turn, the next attack roll made by another creature against the target gains a +5 bonus to the roll. An attack roll can gain only one Sundering Blow bonus.

classFeatures.name: Persistent Rage
classFeatures.description:
When you roll Initiative, you can regain all expended uses of Rage. After you regain uses of Rage in this way, you can’t do so again until you finish a Long Rest.

In addition, your Rage is so fierce that it now lasts for 10 minutes without you needing to do anything to extend it from round to round. Your Rage ends early if you have the Unconscious condition (not just the Incapacitated condition) or don Heavy armor.

classFeatures.name: 16: Ability Score Improvement
classFeatures.description: You gain the Ability Score Improvement feat or another feat of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeatures.name: Improved Brutal Strike
classFeatures.description: The extra damage of your Brutal Strike increases to 2d10. In addition, you can use two different Brutal Strike effects whenever you use your Brutal Strike feature.

classFeatures.name: Indomitable Might
classFeatures.description: If your total for a Strength check or Strength saving throw is less than your Strength score, you can use that score in place of the total.

classFeatures.name: Epic Boon
classFeatures.description: You gain an Epic Boon feat or another feat of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeatures.name: Primal Champion
classFeatures.description: You embody primal power. Your Strength and Constitution scores increase by 4, and their maximum is now 25.

subclassDefinition.name: Path of the Zealot
subclassDefinition.description:
Rage in Ecstatic Union with a God

Barbarians who walk the Path of the Zealot receive boons from a god or pantheon. These Barbarians experience their Rage as an ecstatic episode of divine union that infuses them with power. They are often allies to the priests and other followers of their god or pantheon.

classFeatures.name: Divine Fury
classFeatures.description: You can channel divine power into your strikes. On each of your turns while your Rage is active, the first creature you hit with a weapon or an Unarmed Strike takes extra damage equal to 1d6 plus half your Barbarian level (round down). The extra damage is Necrotic or Radiant; you choose the type each time you deal the damage.

classFeatures.name: Warrior of the Gods
classFeatures.description:
A divine entity helps ensure you can continue the fight. You have a pool of four d12s that you can spend to heal yourself. As a Bonus Action, you can expend dice from the pool, roll them, and regain a number of Hit Points equal to the roll’s total.

Your pool regains all expended dice when you finish a Long Rest.

The pool’s maximum number of dice increases by one when you reach Barbarian levels 6 (5 dice), 12 (6 dice), and 17 (7 dice).

classFeatures.name: Fanatical Focus
classFeatures.description: Once per active Rage, if you fail a saving throw, you can reroll it with a bonus equal to your Rage Damage bonus, and you must use the new roll.

classFeatures.name: Zealous Presence
classFeatures.description:
As a Bonus Action, you unleash a battle cry infused with divine energy. Up to ten other creatures of your choice within 60 feet of you gain Advantage on attack rolls and saving throws until the start of your next turn.

Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a Long Rest unless you expend a use of your Rage (no action required) to restore your use of it.

classFeatures.name: Rage of the Gods
classFeatures.description:
When you activate your Rage, you can assume the form of a divine warrior. This form lasts for 1 minute or until you drop to 0 Hit Points. Once you use this feature, you can’t do so again until you finish a Long Rest.

While in this form, you gain the benefits below.

Flight. You have a Fly Speed equal to your Speed and can hover.

Resistance. You have Resistance to Necrotic, Psychic, and Radiant damage.

Revivification. When a creature within 30 feet of you would drop to 0 Hit Points, you can take a Reaction to expend a use of your Rage to instead change the target’s Hit Points to a number equal to your Barbarian level.

Revivification. When a creature within 30 feet of you would drop to 0 Hit Points, you can take a Reaction to expend a use of your Rage to instead change the target’s Hit Points to a number equal to your Barbarian level.

definition.name: Core Barbarian Traits
definition.description:
As a Level 1 Character:

  • Gain all the traits in the Core Barbarian Traits table.
  • Gain the Barbarian’s level 1 features.
Core Barbarian Traits
Primary Ability Strength
Hit Point Die D12 per Barbarian level
Saving Throw Proficiencies Strength and Constitution
Skill Proficiencies Choose 2: Animal Handling, Athletics, Intimidation, Nature, Perception, or Survival
Weapon Proficiencies Simple and Martial weapons
Armor Training Light and Medium armor and Shields
Starting Equipment Choose A or B: (A) Greataxe, 4 Handaxes, Explorer’s Pack, and 15 GP; or (B) 75 GP
definition.multiClassDescription:
As a Multiclass Character:

  • Gain the following traits from the Core Barbarian Traits table: Hit Point Die, proficiency with Martial weapons, and training with Shields.
  • Gain the Barbarian’s level 1 features.
Core Barbarian Traits
Primary Ability Strength
Hit Point Die D12 per Barbarian level
Weapon Proficiencies Martial weapons
Armor Training Shields

definition.name: Rage
definition.description:
You can imbue yourself with a primal power called Rage, a force that grants you extraordinary might and resilience. You can enter it as a Bonus Action if you aren’t wearing Heavy armor.

You can enter your Rage the number of times shown for your Barbarian level in the Rages column of the Barbarian Features table. You regain one expended use when you finish a Short Rest, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.

While active, your Rage follows the rules below.

Damage Resistance. You have Resistance to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage.

Rage Damage. When you make an attack using Strength—with either a weapon or an Unarmed Strike—and deal damage to the target, you gain a bonus to the damage that increases as you gain levels as a Barbarian, as shown in the Rage Damage column of the Barbarian Features table.

Strength Advantage. You have Advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws.

No Concentration or Spells. You can’t maintain Concentration, and you can’t cast spells.

Duration. The Rage lasts until the end of your next turn, and it ends early if you don Heavy armor or have the Incapacitated condition. If your Rage is still active on your next turn, you can extend the Rage for another round by doing one of the following:

  • Make an attack roll against an enemy.
  • Force an enemy to make a saving throw.
  • Take a Bonus Action to extend your Rage.

Each time the Rage is extended, it lasts until the end of your next turn. You can maintain a Rage for up to 10 minutes.

definition.name: Rage
definition.description:
You can imbue yourself with a primal power called Rage, a force that grants you extraordinary might and resilience. You can enter it as a Bonus Action if you aren’t wearing Heavy armor.

You can enter your Rage the number of times shown for your Barbarian level in the Rages column of the Barbarian Features table. You regain one expended use when you finish a Short Rest, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.

While active, your Rage follows the rules below.

Damage Resistance. You have Resistance to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage.

Rage Damage. When you make an attack using Strength—with either a weapon or an Unarmed Strike—and deal damage to the target, you gain a bonus to the damage that increases as you gain levels as a Barbarian, as shown in the Rage Damage column of the Barbarian Features table.

Strength Advantage. You have Advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws.

No Concentration or Spells. You can’t maintain Concentration, and you can’t cast spells.

Duration. The Rage lasts until the end of your next turn, and it ends early if you don Heavy armor or have the Incapacitated condition. If your Rage is still active on your next turn, you can extend the Rage for another round by doing one of the following:

  • Make an attack roll against an enemy.
  • Force an enemy to make a saving throw.
  • Take a Bonus Action to extend your Rage.

Each time the Rage is extended, it lasts until the end of your next turn. You can maintain a Rage for up to 10 minutes.

Select Activate Rage below to apply the effects from Rage. Deselect it to stop Raging.
definition.snippet: You can take a Bonus action to enter Rage if you aren’t wearing Heavy Armor. You can use Rage {{scalevalue}} times per Long Rest, and regain one expended use when you finish a Short Rest. Activate Rage by clicking on this feature and selecting the drop down called Activate Rage. Deselect it to stop Raging.

definition.name: Unarmored Defense
definition.description: While you aren’t wearing any armor, your base Armor Class equals 10 plus your Dexterity and Constitution modifiers. You can use a Shield and still gain this benefit.
definition.snippet: While not wearing armor, your base AC equals {{10+modifier:dex+modifier:con#unsigned}} + any Shield bonus.

definition.name: Weapon Mastery
definition.description:
Your training with weapons allows you to use the mastery properties of two kinds of Simple or Martial Melee weapons of your choice. Whenever you finish a Long Rest, you can practice weapon drills and change one of those weapon choices.

When you reach certain Barbarian levels, you gain the ability to use the mastery properties of more kinds of weapons, as shown in the Weapon Mastery column of the Barbarian Features table.
definition.snippet: You are able to use the mastery properties of {{scalevalue}} kinds of Simple or Martial Melee weapons of your choice. Whenever you finish a Long Rest, you can change one of those weapon choices.

definition.name: Danger Sense
definition.description: You gain an uncanny sense of when things aren’t as they should be, giving you an edge when you dodge perils. You have Advantage on Dexterity saving throws unless you have the Incapacitated condition.
definition.snippet: You have Advantage on Dex. saving throws unless you have the Incapacitated condition.

definition.name: Reckless Attack
definition.description: You can throw aside all concern for defense to attack with increased ferocity. When you make your first attack roll on your turn, you can decide to attack recklessly. Doing so gives you Advantage on attack rolls using Strength until the start of your next turn, but attack rolls against you have Advantage during that time.
definition.snippet: When you make your first attack roll on your turn, you can decide to attack recklessly, giving you Advantage on attack rolls using Str. until the start of your next turn, but attacks against you have Advantage during that time.

definition.name: Divine Fury
definition.description: You can channel divine power into your strikes. On each of your turns while your Rage is active, the first creature you hit with a weapon or an Unarmed Strike takes extra damage equal to 1d6 plus half your Barbarian level (round down). The extra damage is Necrotic or Radiant; you choose the type each time you deal the damage.
definition.snippet: On each of your turns while your Rage is active, the first creature you hit with a weapon or an Unarmed Strike takes an additional 1d6{{(classlevel/2)@rounddown#signed}} Radiant or Necrotic damage (choose each time you deal the damage).

definition.name: Warrior of the Gods
definition.description:
A divine entity helps ensure you can continue the fight. You have a pool of four d12s that you can spend to heal yourself. As a Bonus Action, you can expend dice from the pool, roll them, and regain a number of Hit Points equal to the roll’s total.

Your pool regains all expended dice when you finish a Long Rest.

The pool’s maximum number of dice increases by one when you reach Barbarian levels 6 (5 dice), 12 (6 dice), and 17 (7 dice).
definition.snippet: You have a pool of {{scalevalue}} that you can spend to heal yourself. As a Bonus Action, you can expend dice from the pool by rolling them and regaining HP equal to the roll’s total. You regain all expended dice when you finish a Long Rest.

definition.name: Barbarian Subclass
definition.description: You gain a Barbarian subclass of your choice. A subclass is a specialization that grants you features at certain Barbarian levels. For the rest of your career, you gain each of your subclass’s features that are of your Barbarian level or lower.

definition.name: Primal Knowledge
definition.description:
You gain proficiency in another skill of your choice from the skill list available to Barbarians at level 1.

In addition, while your Rage is active, you can channel primal power when you attempt certain tasks; whenever you make an ability check using one of the following skills, you can make it as a Strength check even if it normally uses a different ability: Acrobatics, Intimidation, Perception, Stealth, or Survival. When you use this ability, your Strength represents primal power coursing through you, honing your agility, bearing, and senses.
definition.snippet:
You gain proficiency in another Barbarian skill of your choice.

While Raging, whenever you make an ability check using one of the following skills, you can make it as a Str. check even if it normally uses a different ability: Acrobatics, Intimidation, Perception, Stealth, or Survival.

definition.name: Ability Score Improvement
definition.description: You gain the Ability Score Improvement feat or another feat of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Barbarian levels 8, 12, and 16.

definition.name: 4: Weapon Mastery
definition.description:
Your training with weapons allows you to use the mastery properties of two kinds of Simple or Martial Melee weapons of your choice, such as Greataxes and Handaxes. Whenever you finish a Long Rest, you can practice weapon drills and change one of those weapon choices.

When you reach certain Barbarian levels, you gain the ability to use the mastery properties of more kinds of weapons, as shown in the Weapon Mastery column of the Barbarian Features table.

definition.name: Extra Attack
definition.description: You can attack twice instead of once whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.
definition.snippet: You can attack twice instead of once whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

definition.name: Fast Movement
definition.description: Your speed increases by 10 feet while you aren’t wearing Heavy armor.
definition.snippet: Your speed increases by 10 ft. while you aren’t wearing Heavy armor.

definition.name: Fanatical Focus
definition.description: Once per active Rage, if you fail a saving throw, you can reroll it with a bonus equal to your Rage Damage bonus, and you must use the new roll.
definition.snippet: Once per active Rage, if you fail a saving throw, you can reroll it with a {{(12+classlevel)/7#rounddown,min:2,signed}} bonus, and you must use the new roll.

definition.name: Feral Instinct
definition.description: Your instincts are so honed that you have Advantage on Initiative rolls.
definition.snippet: You have Advantage on Initiative rolls.

definition.name: Instinctive Pounce
definition.description: As part of the Bonus Action you take to enter your Rage, you can move up to half your Speed.
definition.snippet: As part of the Bonus Action you take to enter your Rage, you can move up to half your Speed.

definition.name: 8: Ability Score Improvement
definition.description: You gain the Ability Score Improvement feat or another feat of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Barbarian levels 12 and 16.

definition.name: Brutal Strike
definition.description:
If you use Reckless Attack, you can forgo any Advantage on one Strength-based attack roll of your choice on your turn. The chosen attack roll mustn’t have Disadvantage. If the chosen attack roll hits, the target takes an extra 1d10 damage of the same type dealt by the weapon or Unarmed Strike, and you can cause one Brutal Strike effect of your choice. You have the following effect options.

Forceful Blow. The target is pushed 15 feet straight away from you. You can then move up to half your Speed straight toward the target without provoking Opportunity Attack;Opportunity Attacks.

Hamstring Blow. The target’s Speed is reduced by 15 feet until the start of your next turn. A target can be affected by only one Hamstring Blow at a time—the most recent one.
definition.snippet: If you use Reckless attack, you can forgo Advantage on one Strength-based attack of your choice on your turn. The chosen attack roll must not have Disadvantage. If the chosen attack roll hits, the target takes an extra {{scalevalue}}d10 damage of the same type dealt by the weapon or Unarmed Strike, you can cause {{scalevalue}} Brutal Strike effect(s) of your choice.

Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a Long Rest unless you expend a use of your Rage (no action required) to restore your use of it.
definition.snippet:

After using this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a Long Rest unless you expend a use of your Rage (no action required).

definition.name: 10: Weapon Mastery
definition.description: Your training with weapons allows you to use the mastery properties of another kind of Simple or Martial Melee weapons of your choice. Whenever you finish a Long Rest, you can practice weapon drills and change one of your chosen weapon choices.

definition.name: Relentless Rage
definition.description:
Your Rage can keep you fighting despite grievous wounds. If you drop to 0 Hit Points while your Rage is active and don’t die outright, you can make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw. If you succeed, your Hit Points instead change to a number equal to twice your Barbarian level.

Each time you use this feature after the first, the DC increases by 5. When you finish a Short or Long Rest, the DC resets to 10.
definition.snippet:
If you drop to 0 HP while Raging and don’t die outright, you can make a DC 10 Con. saving throw. If you succeed, your HP instead becomes {{2*classlevel}}.

Each subsequent use of this feature increases the DC by 5. After you finish a Short/Long Rest, the DC resets to 10.

definition.name: 12: Ability Score Improvement
definition.description: You gain the Ability Score Improvement feat or another feat of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Barbarian level 16.

definition.name: Improved Brutal Strike
definition.description:
You have honed new ways to attack furiously. The following effects are now among your Brutal Strike options.

Staggering Blow. The target has Disadvantage on the next saving throw it makes, and it can’t make Opportunity Attack;Opportunity Attacks until the start of your next turn.

Sundering Blow. Before the start of your next turn, the next attack roll made by another creature against the target gains a +5 bonus to the roll. An attack roll can gain only one Sundering Blow bonus.
definition.snippet: You learn two additional Brutal Strike effects: Staggering Blow and Sundering Blow.

While in this form, you gain the benefits below.

Flight. You have a Fly Speed equal to your Speed and can hover.

Resistance. You have Resistance to Necrotic, Psychic, and Radiant damage.

Revivification. When a creature within 30 feet of you would drop to 0 Hit Points, you can take a Reaction to expend a use of your Rage to instead change the target’s Hit Points to a number equal to your Barbarian level.

    • You have a Fly Speed equal to your Speed and can hover.
    • You have Resistance to Necrotic, Psychic, and Radiant damage.
    • When a creature within 30 ft. of you would drop to 0 HP, you can take a Reaction to expend a use of Rage to instead change the target’s HP to {{classlevel}}.

You can use this feature once per Long Rest.

definition.name: Persistent Rage
definition.description:
When you roll Initiative, you can regain all expended uses of Rage. After you regain uses of Rage in this way, you can’t do so again until you finish a Long Rest.

In addition, your Rage is so fierce that it now lasts for 10 minutes without you needing to do anything to extend it from round to round. Your Rage ends early if you have the Unconscious condition (not just the Incapacitated condition) or don Heavy armor.
definition.snippet:
Once per Long Rest, when you roll Initiative, you can regain all expended uses of Rage.

In addition, your Rage now lasts for 10 minutes without you needing to take any additional actions to extend it from round to round. Your Rage ends early if you have the if you have the Unconscious condition (not just the Incapacitated condition) or don Heavy armor.

definition.name: 16: Ability Score Improvement
definition.description: You gain the Ability Score Improvement feat or another feat of your choice for which you qualify.

definition.name: Improved Brutal Strike
definition.description: The extra damage of your Brutal Strike increases to 2d10. In addition, you can use two different Brutal Strike effects whenever you use your Brutal Strike feature.
definition.snippet: The extra damage of your Brutal Strike increases to 2d10 and you can use two different Brutal Strike effects whenever you use your Brutal Strike feature.

definition.name: Indomitable Might
definition.description: If your total for a Strength check or Strength saving throw is less than your Strength score, you can use that score in place of the total.
definition.snippet: Your total for a Strength check or Strength saving throw cannot be lower than {{abilityscore:str}}.

definition.name: Epic Boon
definition.description: You gain an Epic Boon feat or another feat of your choice for which you qualify.

definition.name: Primal Champion
definition.description: You embody primal power. Your Strength and Constitution scores increase by 4, and their maximum is now 25.
definition.snippet: Your Strength and Constitution increase by 4, and their maximum is now 25.

definition.name: Ability Score Improvement
definition.description:
General Feat (Prerequisite: Level 4+)

Increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. This feat can’t increase an ability score above 20.

Repeatable. You can take this feat more than once.
definition.snippet: Increase one ability score by 2 or two ability scores by 1.

definition.name: Weapon Mastery

Your training with weapons allows you to use the mastery properties of two kinds of Simple or Martial Melee weapons of your choice, such as Greataxes and Handaxes. Whenever you finish a Long Rest, you can practice weapon drills and change one of those weapon choices.

When you reach certain Barbarian levels, you gain the ability to use the mastery properties of more kinds of weapons, as shown in the Weapon Mastery column of the Barbarian Features table.

When you reach certain Barbarian levels, you gain the ability to use the mastery properties of more kinds of weapons, as shown in the Weapon Mastery column of the Barbarian Features table.

definition.name: Black Dragon
definition.description: You have a Black Dragon ancestor.
definition.snippet: You have a Black Dragon ancestor.

definition.name: Breath Weapon (Acid)
definition.description:
When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with an exhalation of magical energy in either a 15-foot Cone or a 30-foot Line that is 5 feet wide (choose the shape each time). Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC 8 plus your Constitution modifier and Proficiency Bonus). On a failed save, a creature takes 1d10 Acid damage. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage. This damage increases by 1d10 when you reach character levels 5 (2d10), 11 (3d10), and 17 (4d10).

You can use this Breath Weapon a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.
definition.snippet: When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can replace one attack with a breath weapon that is a 15-ft. Cone or a 30-ft. Line that’s 5 ft. wide (choose the shape each time). Each creature must make a DC {{savedc:con}} Dex. saving throw taking {{1+((1+characterlevel)/6)@rounddown}}d10 Acid damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a success.

definition.name: Draconic Resistance (Acid)
definition.description: You have resistance to Acid Damage.
definition.snippet: You have resistance to Acid Damage.

definition.name: Increase two scores (+2 / +1)
definition.description: Increase one scores by 2 and a different score by 1.
definition.snippet: Increase one scores by 2 and a different score by 1.

options.label: Greataxe (Cleave)
options.description:
Your training with weapons allows you to use the mastery property of Greataxes:

Cleave. If you hit a creature with a melee attack roll using a Greataxe, you can make a melee attack roll with the Greataxe against a second creature within 5 feet of the first that is also within your reach. On a hit, the second creature takes the Greataxe’s damage, but don’t add your ability modifier to that damage unless that modifier is negative. You can make this extra attack only once per turn.

options.label: Halberd (Cleave)
options.description:
Your training with weapons allows you to use the mastery property of Halberds:

Cleave. If you hit a creature with a melee attack roll using a Halberd, you can make a melee attack roll with the Halberd against a second creature within 5 feet of the first that is also within your reach. On a hit, the second creature takes the Halberd’s damage, but don’t add your ability modifier to that damage unless that modifier is negative. You can make this extra attack only once per turn.

options.label: Glaive (Graze)
options.description:
Your training with weapons allows you to use the mastery property of Glaives:

Graze. If your attack roll with a Glaive misses a creature, you can deal damage to that creature equal to the ability modifier you used to make the attack roll. This damage is the same type dealt by the Glaive, and the damage can be increased only by increasing the ability modifier.

options.label: Greatsword (Graze)
options.description:
Your training with weapons allows you to use the mastery property of Greatswords:

Graze. If your attack roll with a Greatsword misses a creature, you can deal damage to that creature equal to the ability modifier you used to make the attack roll. This damage is the same type dealt by the Greatsword, and the damage can be increased only by increasing the ability modifier.

options.label: Dagger (Nick)
options.description:
Your training with weapons allows you to use the mastery property of Daggers:

Nick. When you make the extra attack of the Light property, you can make it as part of the Attack action instead of as a Bonus Action. You can make this extra attack only once per turn.

options.description:
Your training with weapons allows you to use the mastery property of Light Hammers:

Nick. When you make the extra attack of the Light property, you can make it as part of the Attack action instead of as a Bonus Action. You can make this extra attack only once per turn.

Vex. If you hit a creature with a Hand Crossbow and deal damage to the creature, you have Advantage on your next attack roll against that creature before the end of your next turn.

race.name: Breath Weapon (Acid)
race.description:
When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with an exhalation of magical energy in either a 15-foot Cone or a 30-foot Line that is 5 feet wide (choose the shape each time). Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC 8 plus your Constitution modifier and Proficiency Bonus). On a failed save, a creature takes 1d10 Acid damage. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage. This damage increases by 1d10 when you reach character levels 5 (2d10), 11 (3d10), and 17 (4d10).

You can use this Breath Weapon a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.
race.snippet: When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can replace one attack with a breath weapon that is a 15-ft. Cone or a 30-ft. Line that’s 5 ft. wide (choose the shape each time). Each creature must make a DC {{savedc:con}} Dex. saving throw taking {{1+((1+characterlevel)/6)@rounddown}}d10 Acid damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a success.

race.name: Draconic Flight
race.description: When you reach character level 5, you can channel draconic magic to give yourself temporary flight. As a Bonus Action, you sprout spectral wings on your back that last for 10 minutes or until you retract the wings (no action required) or have the Incapacitated condition. During that time, you have a Fly Speed equal to your Speed. Your wings appear to be made of the same energy as your Breath Weapon. Once you use this trait, you can’t use it again until you finish a Long Rest.
race.snippet: Once per Long Rest, you gain temporary flight for 10 minutes or until you retract the wings (no action required) or have the Incapacitated condition. During that time, you have a Fly Speed equal to your Speed.

class.name: Rage (Enter)
class.description:
You can imbue yourself with a primal power called Rage, a force that grants you extraordinary might and resilience. You can enter it as a Bonus Action if you aren’t wearing Heavy armor.

You can enter your Rage the number of times shown for your Barbarian level in the Rages column of the Barbarian Features table. You regain one expended use when you finish a Short Rest, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.

While active, your Rage follows the rules below.

Damage Resistance. You have Resistance to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage.

Rage Damage. When you make an attack using Strength—with either a weapon or an Unarmed Strike—and deal damage to the target, you gain a bonus to the damage that increases as you gain levels as a Barbarian, as shown in the Rage Damage column of the Barbarian Features table.

Strength Advantage. You have Advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws.

No Concentration or Spells. You can’t maintain Concentration, and you can’t cast spells.

Duration. The Rage lasts until the end of your next turn, and it ends early if you don Heavy armor or have the Incapacitated condition. If your Rage is still active on your next turn, you can extend the Rage for another round by doing one of the following:

  • Make an attack roll against an enemy.
  • Force an enemy to make a saving throw.
  • Take a Bonus Action to extend your Rage.

Each time the Rage is extended, it lasts until the end of your next turn. You can maintain a Rage for up to 10 minutes.
class.snippet: You can enter Rage if you aren’t wearing Heavy Armor. You can use Rage {{limiteduse}} times per Long Rest, and regain one expended use when you finish a Short Rest.

class.name: Warrior of the Gods: Expend Dice
class.description:
A divine entity helps ensure you can continue the fight. You have a pool of four d12s that you can spend to heal yourself. As a Bonus Action, you can expend dice from the pool, roll them, and regain a number of Hit Points equal to the roll’s total.

Your pool regains all expended dice when you finish a Long Rest.

The pool’s maximum number of dice increases by one when you reach Barbarian levels 6 (5 dice), 12 (6 dice), and 17 (7 dice).
class.snippet: You have a pool of {{scalevalue}} that you can spend to heal yourself. As a Bonus Action, you can expend dice from the pool by rolling them and regaining HP equal to the roll’s total. You regain all expended dice when you finish a Long Rest.

class.restriction: while you aren’t wearing Heavy armor.
